  16. (* Handling of sections in bytecode executable files *)


  19. module Name : sig

  21.   type raw_name = private string

  23. ‌  type t =
  24.     | CODE (** bytecode *)
  25.     | CRCS (** crcs for modules *)
  26.     | DATA (** global data (constant) *)
  27.     | DBUG (** debug info *)
  28.     | DLLS (** dll names *)
  29.     | DLPT (** dll paths *)
  30.     | PRIM (** primitives names *)
  31.     | RNTM (** The path to the bytecode interpreter (use_runtime mode) *)
  32.     | SYMB (** global identifiers *)
  33.     | Other of raw_name

  35. ‌  val of_string : string -> t
  36.   (** @raise Invalid_argument if the input is not of size 4 *)

  38. ‌  val to_string : t -> string
  39. end

  41. (** Recording sections written to a bytecode executable file *)

  43. ‌type toc_writer

  45. ‌val init_record: out_channel -> toc_writer
  46. (** Start recording sections from the current position in out_channel *)

  48. ‌val record: toc_writer -> Name.t -> unit
  49. (** Record the current position in the out_channel as the end of
  50.     the section with the given name. *)

  52. ‌val write_toc_and_trailer: toc_writer -> unit
  53. (** Write the table of contents and the standard trailer for bytecode
  54.     executable files *)

  56. (** Reading sections from a bytecode executable file *)

  58. ‌type section_entry = {
  59.   name : Name.t; (** name of the section. *)
  60.   pos  : int;    (** byte offset at which the section starts. *)
  61.   len  : int;    (** length of the section. *)
  62. }

  64. ‌type section_table

  66. exception Bad_magic_number

  68. ‌val read_toc: in_channel -> section_table
  69. (** Read the table of sections from a bytecode executable.
  70.     Raise [Bad_magic_number] if magic number doesn't match *)

  72. ‌val seek_section: section_table -> in_channel -> Name.t -> int
  73. (** Position the input channel at the beginning of the section named "name",
  74.     and return the length of that section.  Raise Not_found if no
  75.     such section exists. *)

  77. ‌val read_section_string: section_table -> in_channel -> Name.t -> string
  78. (** Return the contents of a section, as a string. *)

  80. ‌val read_section_struct: section_table -> in_channel -> Name.t -> 'a
  81. (** Return the contents of a section, as marshalled data. *)

  83. ‌val all : section_table -> section_entry list
  84. (** Returns all [section_entry] from a [section_table] in increasing
  85.    position order. *)

  87. ‌val pos_first_section : section_table -> int
  88. (** Return the position of the beginning of the first section *)
